bug.author: LordLamy
bug.summary: NEED FAST HELP! Tensorflow Training Error
bug.description:
Hi, I am trying to code an AI with an linear regression algorithm with tensorflow. But my model gives an error message when i try to train it: This is my code linear_est.train(train_input_fn) # train result = linear_est.evaluate(eval_input_fn) # get model metrics/stats by testing on tetsing data clear_output() # clears consoke output print(result) # the result variable is simply a dict of stats about our model And it says: InvalidArgumentError: assertion failed: [Labels must be <= n_classes - 1] [Condition x <= y did not hold element-wise:] [x (head/losses/Cast:0) = ] [[8][10][2]...] [y (head/losses/check_label_range/Const:0) = ] [1] [[{{node Assert}}]] Take a look at the rest if you want to here: <denchmark-link:https://drive.google.com/open?id=1kN3fnQQKJk2VdIZvj1XFrxg73C8BKaWz>https://drive.google.com/open?id=1kN3fnQQKJk2VdIZvj1XFrxg73C8BKaWz</denchmark-link>
Big Thanks and best Regards Justin

comments.comment: This is better suited for StackOverflow
